file_insights.changes: Added ErrorBoundary wrapper around App component
file_insights.impact: Error boundary now catches and handles React errors in the entire application component tree

patterns_discovered.description: ErrorBoundary is correctly positioned as innermost provider, wrapping only the App component, while BrowserRouter and ThemeProvider remain at higher levels
patterns_discovered.significance: Proper provider ordering ensures error boundary works at application level while theme and routing remain unaffected by component errors

patterns_discovered.description: ErrorBoundary imported from common components directory following existing project structure
patterns_discovered.significance: Maintains consistency with other provider and utility component imports

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: Error boundary placement in nesting order
gotchas_discovered.description: ErrorBoundary must be positioned inside BrowserRouter and ThemeProvider to catch errors in the App component, but outside of higher-level providers that might cause navigation issues
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Current placement is optimal - wrapping App inside ToastProvider ensures error boundary doesn't interfere with toast notifications

approach_outcome.description: ErrorBoundary successfully integrated into application root
approach_outcome.completeness: Complete - single attempt achieved the objective

recommendations.suggestion: Verify that ErrorBoundary component exists at frontend/src/components/common/ErrorBoundary with proper error handling implementation
Add tests to verify error boundary catches and handles React component errors appropriately
Document the error boundary behavior and fallback UI that users will see when application errors occur
